De cruce et via sicut alii
data.note: Assumed by this that it means the same as Stephanus Galterii, the only previous person to be sent to Constantinope - this construction only seems to be used with people who went to Constantinople, Slightly confusing here, since it says "de cruce" - and Stephanus had "cruces"; but the only other possible inference would be same as Huga, and this doesn't make sense, since the Huga set of punishments is specially referred to as such elsewhere in the Gordonio section

data.text: Tenebit pauperem cum viro suo quamdiu vixerit
data.note: It says as long as she lives here, but 2 year above. Also, it is 2 paupers (i.e. one each) betweem her and her husband above. I am going with the version how it is above here, even though the text is different, at least for the purpose of my initial transformation

data.note: NB: it says 1 year in the 1st statement, 2 here, so not quite the same

Assumed by this that it means the same as Stephanus Galterii, the only previous person to be sent to Constantinope - this construction only seems to be used with people who went to Constantinople, Slightly confusing here, since it says "de cruce" - and Stephanus had "cruces"; but the only other possible inference would be same as Huga, and this doesn't make sense, since the Huga set of punishments is specially referred to as such elsewhere in the Gordonio section
